docs.title: Hi/Salut
docs.text:
I'm currently a Senior Software Engineer at Apple in Prague, Czech Republic.

Here's the TLDR about me:

  • Overview: Hands-on Generalist
  • Bilingual: Français, English
  • Hobbies: Hockey, Golf
  • Interests: Automation, Embedded Control Systems, Robotics, AI/ML, Cybersecurity

docs.title: Stack
docs.text:
Right now, I like using:

  • Rust
  • Python
  • Linux
  • Neovim
  • Bash
  • GPG

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text:
• TDD: Test driven development

  • OOP: Object oriented programming

  • DSP: Digital signal processing

  • DAQ: Data acquisition

  • PID: Proportional integral derivative controller

  • LGC: Data acquisition

  • TLS: Transport Layer Security

  • SSH: Secure Shell

  • PGP: Pretty Good Privacy

  • LLM: Large language model

  • MIMO: Control theory#Modern MIMO system design

  • HIL: Hardware in the loop simulation

  • CI: Continuous integration

  • CD: Continuous delivery

  • REST: REST

  • OSI: OSI model

  • OWASP: OWASP

  • FEA: Finite element method

  • CAD: Computer aided design

  • DevOps: DevOps

  • ECU: Electronic control unit

  • MCU: Microcontroller

  • API: API

  • RTOS: Real time operating system

  • CNC: Numerical control

  • PLC: Programmable logic controller

  • HMI: User interface

  • PCB: Printed circuit board

  • UART: Universal asynchronous receiver transmitter

  • UDS: Unified Diagnostic Services

  • CAN: CAN bus

  • XCP: XCP (protocol)

  • SPI: Serial Peripheral Interface

  • I2C: I2C

  • JTAG: JTAG

  • FPGA: Field programmable gate array

  • GPU: Graphics processing units

  • AI: Artificial intelligence

  • ML: Machine learning

  • UNIX: Unix

  • HTTP: HTTP

  • IP: Internet protocol suite

  • TCP: Transmission Control Protocol

  • DNS: Domain Name System

  • UDP: User Datagram Protocol

  • MISRA: Motor Industry Software Reliability Association

  • SDK: Software development kit

  • SoC: System on a chip

  • CVE: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.text:
Static website is hosted with Github Pages see policy here.

Nothing is collected by me.

This site also works without JavaScript (albeit with less functionality and reactivity) and does not make any third-party requests.

docs.text: Python, Rust, Bash, C, C++, C#, Golang, JavaScript, HTML, Lua, SQL, Elixir, Swift

docs.text: Windows, macOS, iOS, Ubuntu, Arch, Debian, Asahi, Fedora, RHEL, Kali, FreeRTOS, QNX

docs.text: TLS, SSH, PGP, HTTP/2/3, TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, XCP, CAN, LIN, UDS, SPI, I2C, JTAG, UART

docs.text: AI/ML, LLM, MIMO, PID, DSP, HIL, TDD, OOP, DSA, CI/CD, REST, UNIX, OSI, OWASP

docs.title: University of Waterloo - Bachelor of Applied Science with Distinction
Apple - Senior Software Engineer
docs.text:
Human Interface Devices

2024-05-30 - Present (0.3150684931506849, 4)

  • Automating iOS/macOS testing and deployment using Bash/Python for all devices supporting Touch ID

  • Collecting and analyzing sensor data to extract core metrics and perform statistical analysis and visualizations

  • Integrating custom Swift native apps into the testing workflows to interact with internal SDK APIs

  • Streamlining AI/ML data processing, model training tasks with automation scripts and cloud computing

  • Developing and managing cloud-based CI/CD pipelines with modern Python tooling: ruff, rye, pytest, mypy

  • Scaling and managing Kubernetes cloud infrastructure for Docker-based web apps and services

docs.title: Apple - Senior Software Engineer
docs.text:
Special Projects Group

2021-06-01 - 2024-05-30 (2.9972602739726026, 36)

  • Developped test infrastructure in Rust, Golang, and Python on bare-metal Linux systems for DSP/DAQ

  • Architected low-level network drivers in Rust and debugging TCP/IP,UDP traffic with Wireshark and Lua

  • Wrote embedded C/C++ protocol translation drivers for SoC to test-rig interfaces on ARM targets

  • Trained and tested AI/ML models utilizing PyTorch for an OpenCV, ffmpeg streaming applications

  • Optimized data analysis and DSP jobs using CUDA for executing parallel computing on GPU in AWS EC2

  • Deployed and debugging embedded C firmware with Bazel over JTAG, UART, and UDS during SoC bring-up

  • Integrated SoC with test-rig Simulink software on RTOS targets and IO hardware for hardware analysis

  • Troubleshooted serial communication (I2C, SPI, CAN) hands-on and calibrating sensors with lab equipment

  • Synthesized actuator control systems via sysid testing, modeling, and frequency domain analysis in MATLAB

  • Designed and building mechatronics components for test system upgrades with NX CAD and ANSYS FEA

  • Managed DevSecOps activities: OS upgrades, OpenVPN, PGP keygen, firewalls, CVE scans, TLS certs, YubiKeys

  • Led efforts to establish scalable cloud CI/CD leveraging Git, Bash, Bazel, Jenkins, Docker, and Ansible

docs.title: Pratt & Whitney Canada - Software Engineer
docs.text:
Test Facilities Computing

2019-08-01 - 2021-06-01 (1.8356164383561644, 22)

  • Shipped production ECU test and build software with modern web stack: Rust, Node, Vue, TypeScript

  • Designed embedded C drivers for RTOS control systems and high-speed ECU data acquisition and processing

  • Maintained concurent C++, C#, Rust microservices running on bare-metal CentOS, RHEL Linux servers

  • Programmed TCP/UDP sockets for communication with APIs/SQL databases and debugged with Wireshark

  • Introduced a new Agile work-flow with Git, Azure CI, Docker, and C++/C/JavaScript unit testing

docs.title: Tesla - Firmware Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
Energy Products

2018-09-01 - 2018-12-31 (0.3315068493150685, 4)

  • Coded MISRA compliant firmware in C for power electronic controls on embedded system's DSP's and MCU's

  • Exposed to full-stack from RTOS kernel, serial drivers APIs (CAN, SPI), application-level controls and diagnostics

  • Deployed an embedded self-test C framework on multiple ECUs eliminating manual debugging at EOL/field

  • Employed a test-driven development mindset by writing C unit tests, SIL/HIL simulations, Golang regression

  • Assured CI in an Agile environment with Atlassian tools, Git, Bash, code review/PR and Jenkins builds

docs.title: Apple - Controls Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
Special Projects Group

2017-08-31 - 2018-08-31 (1.0, 12)

  • Developed a hardware-in-the-loop system for validation of power electronic control algorithms in C on MCU

  • Emulated and optimized high-fidelity discrete plant models on 32-bit Xilinx FPGA for low latency second control

  • Deployed LabVIEW HMI for deterministic communication between PC, PXIe RTOS controller and FPGA

  • Flashed microcontroller via JTAG, serial and Ethernet with the latest software builds for bring-up of PCB

  • Applied DSP theory to convert continuous Simulink filters to discrete firmware in C for data acquisition

  • Implemented automated testing Python frameworks for continuous integration and software regression

  • Designed system harness to interface HIL and PCB from electrical schematics and NI hardware datasheets

docs.title: Altaeros - Systems Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
R & D

2017-01-01 - 2017-04-30 (0.32602739726027397, 4)

  • Performed numerical analysis in Python on prototype of an autonomous aerostat's electromechanical system

  • Utilized electronic lab equipment and LabVIEW HMI to log test data and analyze with MATLAB

docs.title: Ontario Die International - Mechanical Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
R & D

2016-05-01 - 2016-08-31 (0.33424657534246577, 4)

  • Designed robotic components (electrical, hydraulic) of PLC/CNC bending systems in SOLIDWORKS

  • Improved existing technology by applying lean, DFM and DFA principles to prototyping and research projects

  • Automated tedious SOLIDWORKS tasks in VBA and C++ with the API in MS Visual Studio IDE

  • Performed hands-on Q&A HMI testing, machined components, fabricated assemblies with power/hand tools

docs.title: Pratt & Whitney Canada - Project Management (Co-op)
docs.text:
Turbofan Operations

2015-09-01 - 2015-12-31 (0.3315068493150685, 4)

  • Communicated with the OEM in French to assure delivery of a quality engine while exceeding expectations

  • Developed Excel VBA programs allowing for improvements in methods of business metric preparation

  • Collaborated with a multi-disciplinary team to develop logistics plans for new design incorporation

docs.title: Linamar - Manufacturing Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
Skyjack

2015-01-01 - 2015-04-30 (0.32602739726027397, 4)

  • Worked with a team of engineers to troubleshoot production issues at an aerial work platform manufacturer

  • Increased process efficiency by organizing assembly stations and designing of jigs/fixtures with SOLIDWORKS

docs.title: Nor-Arc - Mechanical Engineering (Co-op)
docs.text:
Steel Fabricators

2014-06-01 - 2014-08-31 (0.2493150684931507, 3)

  • Detailed architectural, mechanical and electrical drawings including GD&T in AutoCAD

docs.title: Projects
docs.text:
• Portfolio Web App - Personal

    2024-07-01

    • Showcased portfolio using full-stack development/DevOps skills on GitHub-pages hosted application

  • Golf Launch Monitor - Personal

    2024-02-01

    • Prototyping OpenCV/TensorFlow application to extract golf swing attributes from video on NVIDIA Jetson

  • Hack the Box - Apple Software University

    2023-10-01

    • Solved forensics, web, corruption based challenges using Kali tools nmap, Burp, Ghidra, pwntools, gdb

  • Electric Drum Kit Trainer - Personal

    2023-09-01

    • Developped a Rust based real-time MIDI striking pattern monitor on an NXP ARM running FreeRTOS

  • Robot Arm Controller - ECE 488: Multi-Variable Controls

    2019-04-01

    • Modeled and controlled MIMO non-linear system in MATLAB using optimal LGC control methods

  • Heated Press System - ME 482: Capstone Design Project

    2019-03-01

    • Led electrical system efforts including harnessing/debugging and temperature/motor controls in C on MCU

  • Swift App Training - Apple: Software University

    2018-08-01

    • Reviewed the fundamentals of object oriented programming in Swift and coded an application

  • Data Structures & Algorithms - Introduction to Algorithms

    2018-05-01

    • Covered complexity, sorting algorithms, graphs, and dynamic programming in Jupyter Python notebooks

  • Dune-Buggy Magneto Repair - Personal

    2018-08-01

    • Diagnosed fuel system ignition issue then replaced coil and armature of solid-state system

  • Ball & Beam Lab - ECE481: Digital Control Systems

    2017-08-01

    • Designed LabVIEW HMI, performed system ID, implemented/tuned digital controller on NI cRIO FPGA

  • Python Design Optimization - WKRPT 400: Co-op 5

    2017-04-01

    • Developed Python script to solve material sizing algorithm, presented findings in LaTeX report

  • Drum Rhythm Arduino Hack - WIT Hackathon

    2017-03-01

    • Coded firmware in C and communicated over UART to MATLAB for real-time monitoring of vibration

  • Wind Turbine Pitch Actuator - ME360: Control Systems

    2016-12-01

    • Studied time/frequency domain responses in MATLAB for closed-loop stability of PI controlled Simulink

  • Mining Safety Device - ME380: Engineering Design

    2016-11-01

    • Developed a 3D printed enclosure to protect internal Arduino and sensors of severe underground environment

  • DC Motor Control System - ME360: Control Systems

    2016-10-01

    • Designed PID control in Simulink for a DC motor; implemented in real-time with QUARC C code generation

  • CNC Bending Powertrain - WKRPT 300: Co-op 3

    2016-09-01

    • Performed iterative testing with HMI to gather data for selection; assured compatibility into control system

  • SOLIDWORKS C++ Add-In - WKRPT 300: Co-op 3

    2016-07-01

    • Accelerated assembly drawing package preparation by developing a C++ add-in with the MS Visual Studio IDE

  • Engine Delivery VBA Add-In - WKRPT 200: Co-op 3

    2015-12-01

    • Programmed a report generating VBA project to extract and reduce SAP enterprise software data

  • Hands-on Turbofan Build - WKRPT 200: Co-op 3

    2015-12-01

    • Fabricated a complete turbofan engine assembly upon participation in a theoretical gas turbine course

  • Embedded Robot Design - GENE121: Digital Computation

    2014-04-01

    • Coded a C++ algorithm, designed and assembled a robot to perform a color sorting and movement operation
